summary: This bill, the Stop the Subsidized Green Energy Scam Act, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It seeks to terminate certain production and investment tax credits for wind, solar, and battery energy storage facilities if construction begins after the bill's enactment. The bill specifies amendments to sections 48, 45Y, and 48E of the Code, including provisions for clean electricity tax credits and investment credits. It also mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to issue regulations and guidance to implement the changes.
